results.name: Largest positive primitive root (<p) of n-th prime p.
reference: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 864.
R. Osborn, Tables of All Primitive Roots of Odd Primes Less Than 1000, Univ. Texas Press, 1961.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = Prime[n] - 1, p = Prime[n], t = Table[i, {i, 1, Prime[n] - 1}]}, While[ Union[ PowerMod[ k, t, p]] != t, k-- ]; k]; Table[ f[n], {n, 1, 60}]
xref: A diagonal of triangle in A060749.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 11, 2002
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 11 2002
